target_assessment.notes: [The model correctly spotted the vulnerability_type and the assumptions align with the ground_truth]

other_findings.model_claim: [The contract pays out 1000 ether to any caller that provides a preimage of the fixed hash, but it never records that the reward has been claimed. Once the correct `solution` becomes known (found off-chain or observed on-chain), any account can call `solve(solution)` repeatedly and drain the contract balance in 1000 ether increments (until the balance drops below 1000 ether, at which point calls revert). This is a concrete loss-of-funds vector due to missing state change / one-time-claim enforcement]
other_findings.reasoning: [ Anyone should be able to call the solve function as long they have the correct value so this is a DESIGN_CHOICE]
